pr_title: Add GCloud module for Google Cloud Datastore, Firestore, PubSub, and Spanner emulators

timeline.bodyText: does it really need to be an image? Can't we just use the command for it, since the image is not cached anyways?
timeline.author: bsideup

replies.bodyText: At the beginning I was not able to run it using command but that led me to know more about testcontainers. Now, I did it but had to set up a startupTimeout.
replies.author: eddumelendez

replies.bodyText:
Are we sure about this? 😄
It looks like these setup steps will require a non-trivial amount of time to execute - perhaps even the majority of the startup time.
Would it be worth trying to get more attention on GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-sdk-docker#202 so that we can avoid having these setup steps entirely?
replies.author: rnorth

replies.bodyText: Actually, I missed that we install Java and other things... Yeah, I believe we need to wait for these images :(
replies.author: bsideup

timeline.bodyText: We should probably remove these printlns or use slf4j.
timeline.author: rnorth

replies.bodyText: (There are a few other instances of println in other tests as well)
replies.author: rnorth

timeline.bodyText: Is this assertion useful by this point in time?
timeline.author: rnorth

timeline.bodyText:
Don't we need to call get() on future to ensure that the callback and assertion are fired on this thread?
Also, should we have an Assert.fail() inside onFailure?
timeline.author: rnorth

replies.bodyText:
Ah, I was too excited to look at the code and missed:

It is pending to polish the pubsub test 🙈

😄

timeline.bodyText: Sorry for the mundane comment, but please could you reformat using 4 spaces for indentation? If you have an editorconfig-aware IDE this convention should get picked up automatically.
timeline.author: rnorth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+package org.testcontainers.containers;
+
+import java.util.Arrays;
+
+import org.testcontainers.containers.wait.strategy.Wait;
+
+/**
+ * A Datastore container that relies in google cloud sdk. The container provides
+ * additional instructions to install the components needed in the alpine images.
+ *
+ * Default port is 8081.
+ *
+ * @author Eddú Meléndez
+ */
+public class DatastoreEmulatorContainer extends GCloudGenericContainer<DatastoreEmulatorContainer> {
+
+	private static final String[] CMDS = {"apk --update add openjdk8-jre",

timeline.bodyText:
It would be nice to have a(nother) test that:

Publishes a message with some trivial contents
Pulls that message from a subscription to that topic
Verifies that the trivial contents was received
timeline.author: walles

replies.bodyText: @walles thanks for the suggestions. I have added one more commit introducing that change. 👍🏽
replies.author: eddumelendez

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need this class? Looks redundant to me :)
timeline.author: bsideup

timeline.message:
Add gcloud module

Based on google cloud sdk docker image. This module provides:

* DatastoreEmulatorContainer
* FirestoreEmulatorContainer
* PubSubEmulatorContainer

`SpannerEmulatorContainer` is also provided but is based on its own
docker image.

See gh-2633
Add support to perform additional commands in the container
Update base image and polish commands

timeline.author: rnorth

timeline.bodyText: Please could you reformat this file with spaces, not tabs? 🤓
timeline.author: rnorth

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder, maybe these should be public constants so that they can be used by tests? If we did that, we could do so for the other container classes in this PR.
WDYT @bsideup, @kiview?
timeline.author: rnorth

replies.bodyText: WDYT about not exposing the constants, but getGrpcPort/getHttpPort methods?
replies.author: bsideup

replies.bodyText: looking at some of the other modules, private static final seems like the norm/convention atm. would it make sense to follow up w/ an issue for the broader change to expose these across modules?
replies.author: saturnism

replies.bodyText:
I've been persuaded by @bsideup - many of our other modules have some mechanism for getting the mapped ports, address or URL for the running container. It seems like we should do this here, instead of exposing constants, as it's fundamentally more useful for the user.
I'll take the action to do this, as we've asked @eddumelendez to do too much already. I'll raise a quick PR tonight, and will merge this PR now.
replies.author: rnorth
